a.h1: Blaine School District Home of the Borderites

li.a: Emergency Schedule Changes and Snow Days

div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.h3: Blaine School District covid-19 nutrition plan
div.p: It is the school district's intent to continue providing meals to the young people in our community during this COVID-19 closure. Grab 'n Go meals are now availableÂ for pick up at the school as well as along all existing bus stops. Every child, 18 and under,Â who comes to a pick up point will be provided a meal, regardless of whether or not they are a student of our district. One lunch and one breakfast (for the next day) will be distributed, including a milk for each meal. If you are walking, we suggest bringing a backpack to make transport easier. If you encounter a line at pick-up, please remember to practice social distancing and remain six feet behind the person in front of you.Â
div.h5: pick-up between 11:00 am and noon at schoolÂ parking lot behind new bhs grandstands

p.strong: (This will be happening through Friday, April 3, 2020, then new, in-town,Â neighborhood drop off locations willÂ be added to bus routes.)Â

div.p: For those who will be driving, follow the signs to enter the parking lot off Boblett onto Borderite Way. Go past the football field and turn right before the gymnasiums, going behind the new grandstands. Follow the signs to circle around for a drive through pick-up. Walkers are also welcome and can approach staff from the sidewalk near the back entrance of the high school, behind the gymnasiums.Â

For those who live along bus routes, our drivers and food service staff will be bringing the food to you.Â For now, the routes have been adjusted into six routes, five in Blaine and Birch Bay and one in Pt. Roberts. The routes that have been created do not list every stop, but every area in the district has a bus coming by.Â If you know your normal bus route and stop, find the closest stop to yours, and be out at that time.Â Â Also, many of the routes include locations where the bus will stop for approximately 10 minutes, and those times and locations are listed in bold.Â Please note, we have removed the previously posted maps, as we have been unable to update them as frequently as the routes have had to be adjusted. Our transportation director works hard to keep the times updated as adjustments are made to the routes, and we suggest you check back here regularly for any changes.Â

p.strong: These routes include the new, in-town, neighborhood pick-up locations that began on Monday, April 6, 2020.
